channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Food Waste, Medical Waste & Human Waste in Clarence Road, 7th February
item.description:
DO NOT REMOVE UNTIL THIS PROBLEM HAS BEEN FULLY RESOLVED Food waste, medical waste & human waste in Clarence Road This is an ongoing problem that has been reported for several years, and most recently FMS ref: 8777553 (27 January 2026), and FMS ref: 8802510 (30 January 2026). On each occasion these jobs have been closed literally "within minutes" of posting without the problem ever having been resolved. Please DO NOT REMOVE UNTIL THIS PROBLEM HAS BEEN FULLY RESOLVED.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clarence Road, Deptford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Albany Street and Robert Street, 7th February
item.description:
3 temp road lights not working 3 pedestrian lights making too much noise Causing massive issues on Albany street Conservation area Noise disturbances Danger to public safety Cars beeping horns Cars running red lights as they do not work

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albany Street, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manorway green has dim to no lighting, 7th February
item.description:
Manorway green has either dim or no lighting, when it’s dark out this is a big issue you can barely see beyond and around your surroundings.This is a scary and dangerous atsmophere.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goldcrest Close, Thamesmead, Greater London

item.title: Dead fox, 7th February

item.title: Loud unnecessary noise, 7th February
item.description:
Unbearably loud noise all along the Broadway especially on Saturdays The amplified "music" can even be heard inside the shops - not good for Autistic people and shoppers who just want to go about their business

item.title: Large motor home, 7th February

item.title: Lighting uo my bedroom amd waking me up, 7th February
item.description:
This light is l.e.d a.d so bright shining in my room it has woke me up for years! Nothing is being done. I need it plated off or I will just get someone to disconnect it

item.title: Dumped rubbish accumulating at 17 manor rd n16, 7th February
item.description:
I have reported this issue every week this year. Your response is that it's been fixed. Then the dumping is repeated a couple of days later. When will action be taken against this property?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Manor Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Litter Broadway avenue road junction, 7th February
item.description:
I have reported this three times snd there is an old poster paper sitting by the telephone box on the ground! You can’t miss it. I saw someone clearing up the litter on the corner of avenue road and the Broadway so why dud they miss the collection of paper by the telephone box?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickford Lane, Welling, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A very large amount of dumb house hold furniture, 7th February
item.description:
Hi there there is a large pile of abandoned furniture like old bed frames, kings mattress, broken drawers and cupboards. By the corner of the road. On a windy day it could easily fall and hit a car.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): D'Eynsford Road, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: Pathway has large gaps between slabs, 7th February
item.description:
Constant pathway parking by ravensbourne school parents has caused footpath to loose integrity and slabs to slip. There are now large gaps big enough to trap heals and provide hazard to pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin, 7th February
item.description:
Recurrent problem in this high traffic area, hard on the eye, more so people jog and young families walk by every day having to witness the appalling sight of rubbish.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Erebus Drive, Thamesmead
